page.topic: Execute DELETE Query on a SQL Database
page.description: The Execute DELETE Query on a SQL Database action allows you to delete one or more records from a remote SQL database. Alpha Anywhere will use AlphaDAO (Alpha Data Access Objects) to connect to the remote database.

section.note: It is not necessary to use the Connect to SQL Database action before using this action.

step.description: Enter the required connection string into the Options > Connection string property. If you do not have a ready-made connection string, you may click to display the Connection String dialog.

case.description: Optionally, select a named connection string from the drop-down list.
Optionally, select Specify a connection string and click Build to display the Create SQL Connection String dialog.
Click OK to return to the Script Genie.

step.description: In the Options > Table to delete record(s) from property click the '...' button to display the Select Table dialog.

case.description: Select any combination of check boxes to filter the list of entries.
Select an entry and click OK

step.description: In the Options > WHERE clause property click the '...' button to display the WHERE Clause dialog.
Optionally, if you want to confirm record deletions, select the Options > Prompt for confirmation property.

Optionally, click the '...' button in the Options > Arguments property to display the Define/Edit Arguments dialog. Arguments provide values to use in filter and order expressions. Argument values may come from variables or from user selections at run time.
Optionally, enter a comment that describes the action.

section.description: If you ran this action to generate sample Xbasic code, right click on the action and select View Xbasic.
